system.description: You have sworn to do something difficult, and breaking your vow is a serious matter. Example vows include never raising a weapon, never speaking, or living in poverty. If you do fail to uphold your vow, you must perform some kind of atonement, whether it be religious penance or coming to terms with your failure in some other way. A Vow that is a Major Flaw must be a vow to do something, rather than refrain from something, so that it can drive you to act.
